title: Strategy Game Project
description: A template for real-time or turn-based strategy games. Includes asset pipelines for units, buildings, technologies, and maps with resource management systems.

tags.description: Bug or defect that needs fixing

decks.name: Units
decks.description: Military and civilian units. Add a unit card, start its journey to create it.

cards.content:
Warrior

Basic melee infantry unit.

**Cost:** 50 gold, 1 population
**Stats:** Define HP, damage, and armor values
**Strong vs:** Light units
**Weak vs:** Ranged units

This card uses the **#early-game** and **#melee** tags. Use progression tags to organize your tech tree and unit tags for counter-systems.

> **Sub-Cards Below:** These production tasks were auto-created by the journey when you started this card. Journeys save you from manually creating the same tasks over and over!

Archer

Ranged attack unit.

**Cost:** 60 gold, 20 wood, 1 population
**Stats:** Define HP, damage, armor, and range values
**Strong vs:** Melee units
**Weak vs:** Cavalry

**Requires:** Archery Range building

Archer

Ranged infantry unit effective against air and melee.

**Cost:** Consider resource costs
**Strengths:** Range, anti-air capability
**Weaknesses:** Weak in melee, low HP
**Counter:** Cavalry charges

**Why:** Provides ranged option in rock-paper-scissors balance.

Siege Engine

Heavy unit for destroying buildings.

**Cost:** High resources, slow production
**Strengths:** Massive damage to structures
**Weaknesses:** Slow, vulnerable to units
**Counter:** Fast cavalry

**Consider:** Should it require setup time? Pack/unpack mechanic?

- [ ] Plan animation keyframes
- [ ] Block out motion
- [ ] Refine timing and curves

Implement Unit Logic

Code combat behavior, movement, and abilities.

- [ ] Design implementation approach
- [ ] Write core logic
- [ ] Add edge case handling
- [ ] Write unit tests

Design Unit SFX

Create sounds for movement and combat.

- [ ] Record or source base sounds
- [ ] Edit and layer audio
- [ ] Add variations
- [ ] Integrate in engine
- [ ] Test in game context

Balance Unit Stats

Tune cost, HP, damage for fair gameplay.

- [ ] Define success criteria
- [ ] Implement initial values
- [ ] Playtest
- [ ] Iterate based on feedback
- [ ] Document final values

decks.name: Buildings
decks.description: Structures that produce units, research tech, or gather resources. Add a building card, start its journey.

cards.content:
Town Center

Main base building that trains workers.

**Cost:** Starting building (free)
**Trains:** Worker units
**HP:** 2000
**Special:** Serves as dropoff point for resources

> **Priority:** Marked 'a' because this is your core building - everything depends on it working!

Barracks

Produces military infantry units.

**Cost:** 150 wood
**Trains:** Warrior, Spearman, Swordsman
**HP:** 1200
**Build Time:** 45 seconds

Barracks

Military building for training infantry units.

**Cost:** Define resource requirements
**Function:** Unlocks and produces infantry
**Upgrade Path:** Can upgrade for stronger units

**Consider:** Train time per unit? Queue system?

decks.name: Technologies
decks.description: Researchable upgrades. Add a tech card, start its journey.

cards.content:
Iron Weapons

Upgrade that boosts all melee unit damage.

**Cost:** 200 gold, 100 iron
**Research Time:** 60 seconds
**Effect:** Increases damage for all melee units
**Requires:** Blacksmith building

**Effort Note:** Technologies are quick to add once your research system exists - just 2 effort points!

Melee Weapons Research

Upgrade improving melee unit damage.

**Cost:** Research time and resources
**Effect:** +20% damage for all melee units
**Prerequisites:** Barracks built

**Consider:** Should there be multiple tiers? Diminishing returns?

Advanced Economy

Improves resource gathering efficiency.

**Cost:** High research investment
**Effect:** +15% gather rate for all resources
**Prerequisites:** Market built

**Why:** Rewards economic investment, enables late-game strategies.

decks.name: Maps
decks.description: Playable maps with terrain and resources. Add a map card, start its journey.

cards.content:
Grasslands 1v1

Basic map for learning the game.

**Size:** Small (2 players)
**Starting Resources:** Balanced, nearby
**Terrain:** Mostly flat with small hills
**Features:** Mirror symmetry for fairness

Highland Valleys

Map with elevation differences and chokepoints.

**Features:**
- High ground provides combat bonuses
- Narrow passes create defensive positions
- Central control point

**Playstyle:** Rewards positional play and map control

Test Map Balance

decks.name: Design Notes
decks.description: Design documentation, meeting notes, and playtesting findings. Use this deck to capture design decisions and their rationale.

cards.content:
Design Meeting: Rock-Paper-Scissors Balance

**Date:** Week 3
**Attendees:** Lead Designer, Balance Designer

**Decisions:**
- Each unit type should have clear counters
- No single unit composition should dominate
- Tech tree creates strategic variety

**Rationale:** Counter-play creates strategic depth and replayability.

Playtesting Notes: Early Rush Strategy

**Session:** Week 5 playtest
**Issues:**
- Fast military rush too strong
- Economic players can't defend early aggression

**Changes:** Increased starting resources, added cheap early defense tower.
